div.a: Who Owns Illegal Public Street Art Found On Private Buildings?

div.div: Who owns public art illegally placed onto private buildings? That’s a question that came up recently after a famous Banksy work in London was ripped out of the side of a building, shipped across the Atlantic, and put up for auction with an estimated price of over half a million dollars.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X1Rcta&via=Digg&text=Who Owns Illegal Public Street Art Found On Private Buildings?

div.a: US Government To Air-Drop Toxic Mice On Guam Snakes

div.div: Dead mice laced with painkillers are about to rain down on Guam's jungle canopy. They are scientists' prescription for a headache that has caused the tiny U.S. territory misery for more than 60 years: the brown tree snake.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/139rOF8&via=Digg&text=US Government To Air-Drop Toxic Mice On Guam Snakes

div.a: Watch A Supercut Of People Botching Sally Field's Famous 'You Really LIke Me' Speech

div.div: Field's speech from the 1985 Academy Awards ceremony has reverberated through pop culture in the 28 years since she uttered it. What's more, when it is referenced in movies, on TV, on virtually any talk show discussing the Oscars, it's almost always incorrectly.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/15BuA5T&via=Digg&text=Watch A Supercut Of People Botching Sally Field's Famous 'You Really LIke Me' Speech

div.a: Power Tools Fit For The Amish

div.div: The Amish have chosen to forgo many of the delights of the modern world, but they still need to drill, sand and cut wood. This trade expo shows off all the loopholes that let the Amish get their hands on power tools.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XtS5r0&via=Digg&text=Power Tools Fit For The Amish

div.a: How To Sound Smart During The Oscars: A Cheat Sheet

div.div: For movie buffs, the Oscars are one of the best nights of the year – the elation! the fashion! the inevitable acceptance speech flubs! But watching the Oscars, either with friends at an IRL party or the hivemind of Twitter, Facebook, and other social networks, it can devolve into a big game of Didja Know?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/120dShn&via=Digg&text=How To Sound Smart During The Oscars: A Cheat Sheet

div.a: The 2013 Hater's Guide To The Oscars

div.div: According to "Entertainment Weekly," this year's Oscars will be "song-and-dance heavy," which is arguably the most terrifying thing I have ever read.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YIvWGv&via=Digg&text=The 2013 Hater's Guide To The Oscars

div.a: The Princess And The Trolls

div.div: The heartrending legend of Adalia Rose, the most reviled six-year-old girl on the Internet.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YHTDid&via=Digg&text=The Princess And The Trolls

div.a: Which Car Has The Least Blood On Its Tires?

div.div: It's not that suddenly being around cars sends you on a muderous rampage, it just seems that if you your country has gotten to the point in its development where it can produce automobiles, it's also probably dabbled in colonialism, genocide, war, and persecution.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YMkAjI&via=Digg&text=Which Car Has The Least Blood On Its Tires?

div.a: The Most Terrifying Button On Facebook

div.div: Buried deep in your profile is a button that shows all your activity, including who you search for. Facebook knows your deepest secrets — and it's not letting you forget it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VUrgBk&via=Digg&text=The Most Terrifying Button On Facebook

div.div: ALL FOR THAT UPSIDE DOWN KISS

div.a: Grad Student Creates His Own Working Spider-Man Suit

div.div: Who says you have to get bitten by a radioactive spider to get the power of Spider-Man? One student has used technology to acquire a spidey-sense.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YrLgp1&via=Digg&text=Grad Student Creates His Own Working Spider-Man Suit

div.div: START DROPPING HINTS TO YOUR FAMILY NOW

div.a: Google Glass Available Just In Time For The Holidays

div.div: Does Google's latest promotional video for Glass have you longing for a pair of the augmented reality glasses? Well, we finally have official word from Google that it is aiming to release a "fully-polished" version of the wearable headset to consumers by the end of this year.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YhXhkU&via=Digg&text=Google Glass Available Just In Time For The Holidays

div.div: GET THE WNBA ON THE PHONE

div.a: Cheerleader Nails Halftime Half-Court Trick Flip Shot

div.div: Ashlee Arnau, a cheerleader at William Carey University in Hattiesburg, Mississippi, made one of the greatest halftime half-court trick shots ever during Thursday night’s game against Auburn-Montgomery.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YHFIIZ&via=Digg&text=Cheerleader Nails Halftime Half-Court Trick Flip Shot

div.a: China Has Up To 400 'Cancer Villages,' And The Government Only Just Admitted It

div.div: China’s “growth at all costs” approach to development has meant industries can spew waste pretty much wherever they want. Drinking water sources? Sure. Farmland? Fine. That approach has poisoned entire towns, sending cancer rates soaring.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YIj1o9&via=Digg&text=China Has Up To 400 'Cancer Villages,' And The Government Only Just Admitted It

div.a: Mark Cuban’s Interview With Howard Stern Was Delightful

div.div: I enjoyed the hell out of listening to this because it might be the most honest, revealing glimpse into the life of a filthy rich person I’ve ever run across, and Cuban, to his credit, doesn’t seem to be taking it for granted.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XGFJxJ&via=Digg&text=Mark Cuban’s Interview With Howard Stern Was Delightful

div.a: World's Most Expensive Weapons Program Grounded

div.div: Defense officials have grounded Lockheed Martin’s F-35 Lightning II over an engine problem, in the latest setback for the world’s most expensive weapons program one week before automatic, across-the-board budget restrictions are set to fall.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XHbB5c&via=Digg&text=World's Most Expensive Weapons Program Grounded

div.a: Supermax Prisons: Views From Above

div.div: Have prisons and jails become the mass housing of our time?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12IZV7d&via=Digg&text=Supermax Prisons: Views From Above

div.a: You’re A SEAL Stranded In Hostile Territory: What’s In Your Survival Kit?

div.div: SEALs aren’t supposed to find themselves in trouble that they can’t get out of. That’s why the Navy is seeking to buy 300 new survival kits for the Naval Special Warfare Development Group, sometimes known as Navy SEAL Team 6.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YoHKf2&via=Digg&text=You’re A SEAL Stranded In Hostile Territory: What’s In Your Survival Kit?

div.a: Why Old Men Love Being Naked In The Locker Room

div.div: Why is it they love to stand around naked in front of each other, while younger men just put on their clothes like normal people?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WfcCzd&via=Digg&text=Why Old Men Love Being Naked In The Locker Room

div.div: JUST A DROP IN THE BUCKET

div.a: Why $46 Billion In Pentagon Cuts Shouldn't Make Us Less Safe

div.div: Even if they take effect, America's "defense" budget will dwarf its rivals so overwhelmingly that it's hard to comprehend.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WeBpmQ&via=Digg&text=Why $46 Billion In Pentagon Cuts Shouldn't Make Us Less Safe

div.a: This Man Was Last Seen Alive At Alaska's Brutal Mount Marathon Race

div.div: Like a lot of things in Alaska, the annual Mount Marathon Race in Seward is famously brutal, even dangerous. Which is precisely why Michael LeMaitre ran it--the last day he was seen alive.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/138dEEk&via=Digg&text=This Man Was Last Seen Alive At Alaska's Brutal Mount Marathon Race

div.a: L.A. Hotel Scare: How Sick Will You Get From A Corpse In Water Supply?

div.div: Discovery of a Canadian woman’s remains in a Los Angeles hotel’s water tank is raising fears of serious infection among guests, but unless the victim was poisoned with anthrax or botulism, the bacteria would not be lethal—just nauseating.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XFXs8n&via=Digg&text=L.A. Hotel Scare: How Sick Will You Get From A Corpse In Water Supply?

div.a: On Going To The Playboy Club With My Father

div.div: “Someone at the meeting,” confided Dad, his voice thick with secrecy and excitement, “has a key to the Club. This is very VIP. Strictly big time. Only special people have keys to the Club.” The Playboy Club! The hair on my unshaven legs hackled up. I was a budding feminist and hated Hugh Hefner with the best of them.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12XJfZD&via=Digg&text=On Going To The Playboy Club With My Father

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XCAGy6&via=Digg&text=The Legion Of Real-Life Supervillains

div.a: How “Golden Eagle Snatches Kid” Ruled The Internet

div.div: Four Canadian film students were assigned a project: Create a YouTube hoax video that gets 100,000 views. They got nearly 42 million instead. Here’s how — and why — their homework snowballed into one of the most popular videos ever.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XPDTYy&via=Digg&text=How “Golden Eagle Snatches Kid” Ruled The Internet

div.a: Of Course China Is Building A Full-Size, Working Replica Of The Titanic

div.div: China’s ambitions plan to build the Titanic II, a functioning one-to-one scale replica of the ship synonymous with spectacular tragedy, is proceeding apace. The builders are accepting $1 million offers for the maiden voyage, which is scheduled for 2016.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XG09qy&via=Digg&text=Of Course China Is Building A Full-Size, Working Replica Of The Titanic

div.a: The Germans Who Tried To Topple Hitler

div.div: Seventy years ago today, three German students were executed in Munich for leading a resistance movement against Hitler. Since then, the members of the White Rose group have become German national heroes.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13pwItA&via=Digg&text=The Germans Who Tried To Topple Hitler

div.a: Nate Silver Predicts The Oscars

div.div: Polling wizard Nate Silver correctly predicted all 50 state winners in the 2012 presidential election. Now he's turned his attention to the Oscars.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WeJ7xu&via=Digg&text=Nate Silver Predicts The Oscars

div.a: The True Story Of History's Only Known Meteorite Victim

div.div: The Russian meteorite, whose sonic boom damaged buildings and injured more than a thousand last week, is not the first to shatter a human life.

div.div: DON'T STOP TIL YOU GET MADE INTO LEGO

div.a: The Week’s Most Impressive Use Of LEGOs

div.div: LEGO art has long been a staple of web videos, but this “Lego Dance” by Annette Jung of Talking Animals, which recreates a memorable music-less dance sequence by Michael Jackson, is unusually stylish and impressive.
